ygData.messageBody:
Answer mixed in here...

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Petra Fiene [SMTP:pfi@...]
> Sent: Monday, May 03, 1999 1:39 AM
> To: eqenchanters@onelist.com
> Subject: [eqenchanters] Re: Pet fighting strategies - questions
>
> From: "Petra Fiene" <pfi@...>
>
> Hi fellow enchanters,
>
> ive some questions on fighting strategies with the pet, and the actual
> how-to:
>
> 1. my pet went into melee with some unwanted mob, and i have a safe
> position
> and want the pet to come back to keep it alive, but i found no way to
> to get
> the pet to do so? I just watch the pet getting slain and another 3
> dagger
> going lost.. any suggestions?
>
[Hapke, Matthew] NOpe. No suggestions. This is the life of our
animations. Young , Dumb, and fealress.

> 2. In group fighting with possibly more than one mob, i try to tag the
> different monsters to cast my really fine enchanter spells, clicking
> directly on the chest or head of a monster, and what did i tag? ... my
> pet,
> my partymembers... everything clickable in around the next five
> miles... but
> not the monster i want. F8 always tags my pet.. its quite useless.
> Sometimes
> i loose lots of seconds runnig forth and back or around the battle to
> get
> the mob tagged. The same with 3 orcs running towards us... strategy is
> clear, just root, flux or mesmerize to control 2 of them and wait
> until the
> party slain the first... but the run nearly one orc inside the other,
> chances to tag them in time to cast...zero. its a stupid handling
> prob...and
> that stupid pet is always in the line of sight. Suggestions?
>
[Hapke, Matthew] Click on the health bar of the group member
who is fighting the mob you want to attack, then type /assist The
client will then target your group member's target. Very useful for
enchanters! You should teach your whole group this command so they can
concentrate on one Mob at a time, while you mes the others and make
them wait their turn =)

> 3. anyone ever casted a pet in befallen? i am getting mad about that,
> the
> pet is that nervous runnig around me, and is alwas really far from me,
> and
> get into melee with everything that moves. Once i casted 4 pets
> because
> every 2 minutes i realized, oh the pet got lost somewhere i didnt even
> hear
> a taunting attacker... i run around there a lot, from one door to the
> next,
> and most times i dont even see, where my pet is, and where he gets
> himself
> slain this time. suggestions?
>
[Hapke, Matthew] This happens in all the dungeons. In Black
Burrow where I have spent a lot of time, my pet fequently gets left
behind. He does eventually make it out, but sometimes I have to go and
unstick him.

> Niniel
> lvl 11 darkelf enchantress on Solusek ro
